      Methods in application that return types with arguments of type Food 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Food> StaffScreenModel.getAllFoodFromMenu()
      Retrieves all food objects from the menu which might have been edited by a manager ready for display in a ListView
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Food> StaffScreenModel.retrieveATableOrderFromDB(int tableNoVal)
      This takes a table number and queries the database to find the food items saved in that table order and puts them in an ArrayList that can be passed to the ListViews and displayed with ease.
      Method parameters in application with type arguments of type Food 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void StaffScreenModel.moveCurrentOrderToStorage(int tableNum, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Food> orderList, double totalBill, java.lang.String specialReqs, java.lang.String comments, java.lang.String isComplete, java.util.Date inDate)
      Takes all the order components and then inserts the order into the stored orders (not the current working orders) this is combined with deleting the same order from the current orders therefore having the effect of moving the order from working to stored.
      (package private) void StaffScreenModel.saveCurrentOrderToDatabase(int tableNum, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Food> orderList, double totalBill, java.lang.String specialReqs, java.lang.String comments, java.lang.String isComplete, java.util.Date inDate)
      Checks if the input tableNo already has a working order in the database, if it does it updates all fields apart from the time of order, (and the tableNo as that wouldn't make sense).
